clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Mechanism of Action of Methenamine Hippurate (Hiprex™) in Women With Recurring Urinary Tract Infections.
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Mechanism of Action of Methenamine Hippurate (Hiprex™) in the Management of Recurrent Urinary Tract Infections in Women

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

clinical_study.source: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to measure the concentration of formaldehyde in the urine of women with recurrent urinary tract infections on Hiprex; and then, assuming its urinary presence is confirmed at the proper acid urinary pH, evaluate if such a therapy has favorable effects in decreasing the rate of recurrent urinary tract infections over time.

primary_outcome.description: It would be measured by counting the positive urine cultures, or UTI-like episodes requiring antibiotic treatment during the 1 year of the study period.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of oral-antibiotics use to treat symptomatic UTI episodes
Number of hospitalizations due to urosepsis and pyelonephritis

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of adverse events related to Hiprex
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who experience adverse events >= Grade 3, as defined by Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events by CTCA version 5.0
Urine acidity levels will be measured by urinary pH at each visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of urinary tract infection episodes
secondary_outcome.description: Diagnose of UTI will be measured for this outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of UTI symptoms as measured by the UTI Symptom Assessment questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: UTI Symptom Assessment questionnaire measures severity of UTI symptoms. Possible score range from 0 to 3 (0= Did not have 1= Mild 2=Moderate, and 3=Severe), higher score indicates higher severity of UTI symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of intervals between UTI episodes
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of intervals will be measured between one UTI episode to the next UTI episode

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group 1 - Patients with negative and positive urine culture

intervention.description: Patients with negative urine culture will be prescribed Hiprex 1 g PO BID x 1 yr and patients with a positive urine culture will be prescribed antibiotics.
intervention.arm_group_label: Group 1 - Patients with negative and positive urine culture

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Female
2. Age 50 - 85
3. Have RUTIs (at least 2 UTIs within the past 6 months or 3 within the past year) -
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Being on antibiotics at baseline (i.e. suppressive therapy or antibiotic therapy for urinary or non-urinary infections)
2. Neurogenic bladder condition
3. Using urinary catheters (including Foley catheter, intermittent catheterization, and suprapubic catheter)
4. Uncontrolled diabetes (HbA1c > 9)
5. Chronic renal failure defined as serum creatinine > 1.5 mg/dL
6. History of liver disease
7. Patients from out of town, in whom follow-up will not be possible
8. Pregnancy
9. Allergy to Hiprex
10. Inability to take Hiprex reliably at home, such as having psychosis, dementia, or swallowing disorders
11. Non-English speakers -
